intro: Horkelia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features basal leaves that are hairy and often covered in fine white trichomes. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Horkelia hirsuta is adapted to arid environments and has a compact growth form to conserve moisture.
